intro: Strophanthus paxii, commonly known as the red devil's blood vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a woody climber characterized by its striking red and orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
